bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, April 4, 1902

div1.p: Reed writes about Blincoe's daughter, Laura.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, April 4, 1902

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
April 4, 1902

div1.p:
I enclose
my check for $10.00, in
order to keep the darkey
Cook in good humor.
Tell Lallie that I enjoyed
her letter very much,
and after reading it, that
I felt sure that she
will overcome all
difficulties, and yet be
known as a successful
poultry farmer -- what
beastly weather she has
had to contend with!
